dcterms:creator: K. Banerjee
T. Mitra
dcterms:description: This dataset provides criteria for intergenerational distribution, focusing on the continuity of ethical social welfare orders on infinite utility streams.
dcterms:title: Intergenerational distribution criteria

dcterms:creator: M. Fleurbaey
Ph. Michel
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses intertemporal equity and extends the Ramsey criterion, providing insights into the ethical considerations of intertemporal choices.
dcterms:title: Intertemporal equity

dcterms:creator: L.G. Svensson
dcterms:description: This dataset presents the grading principle, which addresses equity among generations in economic contexts.
dcterms:title: Grading principle

dcterms:creator: O. Evren
E.A. Ok
dcterms:description: This dataset explores multi-utility representations of preference relations, contributing to the understanding of utility functions in economic theory.
dcterms:title: Utility functions

dcterms:creator: T. Sakai
dcterms:description: This dataset provides an axiomatic approach to intergenerational equity, discussing the ethical implications of social welfare.
dcterms:title: Ethical social welfare orders

dcterms:creator: P. Diamond
dcterms:description: This dataset evaluates infinite utility streams, focusing on the implications of the supremum metric in economic analysis.
dcterms:title: Supremum metric

dcterms:creator: K. Banerjee
T. Mitra
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses anonymity and strong monotonicity in the context of ethical social welfare orders, providing insights into their implications.
dcterms:title: Anonymity and strong monotonicity

dcterms:creator: T. Sakai
dcterms:description: This dataset introduces the concept of sensitivity to the present in intergenerational preferences, highlighting its ethical implications.
dcterms:title: Sensitivity to the present
